title: Andreia Norton
text:
Andreia Alexandra Norton (born 15 August 1996) is a Portuguese <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a> who plays as a <a href="Forward%20%28association%20football%29">forward</a> for <a href="S.C.%20Braga%20%28women%27s%20football%29">Braga</a> in the <a href="Campeonato%20Nacional%20de%20Futebol%20Feminino">Campeonato Nacional de Futebol Feminino</a>. She first played for her country in an under nineteen match in 2012 and debuted for the senior team four years later.
Career.
Club.
Norton started to play <a href="Football%20association">football</a> at the age of two in her native city. When Norton was seven, she went to play for the "Furadouro Sports Club", an amateur club in <a href="Ovar">Ovar</a>, where she was the only girl in the team. She used to play as a <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a>, then she started to play in the <a href="Midfielder">midfield</a> and finally settled down as a forward. At the age of 12, she was forced to leave the team, because Portuguese law forbids mixed teams above the age of 12. In 2009, aged 13, Norton went to play for <a href="U.D.%20Oliveirense">U.D. Oliveirense</a>, at that time a team playing in the <a href="Campeonato%20Nacional%20de%20Futebol%20Feminino">Portuguese First Division</a>. Due to her young age she only played a few matches, but scored a goal against <a href="Leix%C3%B5es%20S.C.">Leixões S.C.</a>. U.D. Oliveirense was relegated that season, and later folded. Like most players from Oliveirense, she went to <a href="F.C.%20Cesarense">F.C. Cesarense</a>, where she spent three years. In 2013, Norton signed with <a href="Clube%20de%20Albergaria">Clube de Albergaria</a>. There, she was twice voted the league's best player, at 17 and 18 years of age.
In 2015, Norton was offered a contract with <a href="FC%20Barcelona%20Femen%C3%AD">FC Barcelona</a>. In one of the final matches of the season, against Club de Albergaria, she suffered a serious injury in her left knee, which forced her to undergo surgery twice. As the contract with Barcelona was already signed, she went to <a href="Catalonia">Catalonia</a> but was unable to play any matches for the club. After one year in Spain, she decided to return to Portugal and signed with <a href="S.C.%20Braga%20%28women%27s%20football%29">S.C. Braga</a> in order to get more playing time and therefore recover her previous form. On March 19, 2018, Norton was included by the "Quinas de Ouro" award among the "11 Best Players" in the Portuguese women's league. The award is annually organized by the <a href="Portuguese%20Football%20Federation">Portuguese Football Federation</a> together with the "Associação Nacional dos Treinadores de Futebol" and the "Sindicato dos Jogadores Profissionais de Futebol".
In May 2018, German Frauen-Bundesliga club <a href="SC%20Sand">SC Sand</a> announced that they had signed Norton.
International.
Norton debuted for Portugal U19 in a match against Wales U19 on March 13, 2012. She was part of the team that reached the semi-finals in the <a href="2012%20UEFA%20Women%27s%20Under-19%20Championship">2012 UEFA Women's Under-19 Championship</a>, when they lost 1–0 against Spain in the semi-finals. Norton played with the U19 team until 2015, recording 25 <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29%23Association%20football">caps</a> with nine goals scored. On October 25, 2016, at the age of 20, Norton debuted for the <a href="Portugal%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Portuguese senior team</a> in a <a href="Tie%20%28draw%29">tie</a> against <a href="Romania%20women%27s%20national%20football%20team">Romania</a>. In her debut she scored the goal that enabled Portugal to qualify for a <a href="UEFA%20Women%27s%20Euro%202017">European Women's Championship</a> for the first time. , this is Norton's only international goal. On July 6, 2017, <a href="Francisco%20Neto">Francisco Neto</a> asked Norton to represent Portugal at the <a href="UEFA%20Women%27s%20Euro%202017">UEFA Women's Euro 2017</a>. She did not play any matches as Portugal was eliminated in the group stage.
Personal life.
Norton is the daughter of <a href="Journeyman%20%28sports%29">journeyman</a> Brazilian <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a>, <a href="Valdecir%20Ribeiro%20da%20Silva">Valdecir Ribeiro da Silva</a> (known as "Pingo"), who played for <a href="A.D.%20Ovarense">A.D. Ovarense</a> in the 1995/1996 season. She never met her father, and was raised by her grandmother, aunt, and uncle.
